name: The Morocco Foundation
mission: Morocco Foundation is a 501 (c) (3) non-profit organization. All donations are tax-exempt
theoryOfChange: By providing cost-effective interventions in education (workshops, supplies) and basic needs (water, food, health), the organization aims to prevent school dropout and child labor, ultimately breaking the cycle of poverty.
zakatClaimEvidence: The Morocco Foundation's website and donation pages do not explicitly mention accepting zakat donations, nor do they have dedicated zakat funds or campaigns. (Source: https://www.morocco-foundation.org/donate/)

dimension_explanations.alignment: The charity offers a medium fit for donors, focusing on cultural and regional development in Morocco through sadaqah-eligible giving [1]. While the cause addresses rural poverty, the alignment score reflects a moderate level of urgency and a specific geographic focus that may not match all donor profiles [3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates high financial efficiency with a 95.1% program expense ratio and a low cost per beneficiary of approximately $12.07 [2]. While it holds 8.5 months of working capital, the overall impact score is limited by low data confidence and the absence of extensive third-party impact evaluations [3].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Morocco Foundation works to alleviate poverty and illiteracy within Morocco's rural communities through targeted educational and humanitarian programs.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 95.1%, indicating most funds go directly to services
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with $0.00 spent to raise every $1
Strong short-term liquidity with 8.5 months of working capital available

The organization reported a total revenue of $134,320, focusing its resources on direct program delivery in rural regions [2].

strengths.detail: The foundation maintains a <cite id="4">95.1% program expense ratio</cite> and spends <cite id="5">$0.00 to raise every dollar</cite>, maximizing the direct impact of every donation.
With a track record <cite id="1">dating back to 2004</cite>, the organization has established deep roots in Morocco's rural development sector.
The ABT-MF Academy was honored with the <cite id="7">Best Prize in Education</cite> in 2024, validating its approach to rural literacy.

strengths_deep_dive: The Morocco Foundation's strength lies in its ability to maintain a highly resilient financial position despite its size, holding <cite id="8">8.5 months of working capital</cite> to ensure program continuity. This stability supports a diverse range of direct services, from <cite id="6">constructing water wells</cite> to providing <cite id="9">Ramadan food baskets</cite>, all while maintaining a <cite id="10">clear theory of change</cite> that has been documented through its recent educational awards.
rich_narrative.summary: The Morocco Foundation is a dedicated humanitarian organization <cite id="1">founded in 2004</cite> with a mission to alleviate poverty and illiteracy within Morocco's rural communities. Operating primarily in underserved regions, the foundation implements a multi-faceted approach to development through initiatives like the <cite id="2">ABT-MF Academy workshop program</cite> and themed caravans that deliver essential services. Financially, the organization operates with high efficiency, reporting <cite id="3">total revenue of $134,320</cite> in its most recent filing. A defining characteristic of its fiscal management is a <cite id="4">program expense ratio of 95.1%</cite>, indicating that every dollar of revenue is directed toward its core humanitarian and educational missions. This lean operational model is further evidenced by its <cite id="5">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 spent to raise every $1</cite>, ensuring that donor contributions are not diluted by administrative overhead. Beyond education, the foundation addresses critical infrastructure and survival needs through <cite id="6">water well construction</cite>, social actions, and the distribution of Ramadan food baskets to vulnerable families. Despite its relatively small financial scale, the organization has achieved significant recognition, recently receiving the <cite id="7">Best Prize in Education</cite> at the 2024 WeXchange Forum for its innovative academy model.
